author: John Crawford
comment: Spot on most of the time

author: KEVIN NORMAN BEALE
comment: Very good helpful

author: A F
comment: Have bought pro and activated account in app. Still pops up Ads and redirects to scam iphone win sites.

author: Jennifer Queen
comment: Tried to buy pro, did not upgrade anything on app and now I can't get a refund
Perfect.

author: Mark Minott
comment: The free version is just crippleware, junk. Don't install unless you consider paying $9 per year subscription. Over-priced and underfed app. Deleted.

author: R.W. van der Knoop
comment: Good app

author: Brian G. Benson
comment: Its extremely useful, especially for a trucker that crosses all 48 at any given time.  I use it in conjunction with the meteomap earth and weather pro wind vanes, extremely accurate

author: Luca Mirci
comment: Good app I rely on a lot. I have only one issue with it, and that's is the widget. It sometimes shows weather warnings that are already over. For example , I have now a weather warning for thunderstorms that it says 'ends 2 days ago' I can't see the point in knowing warnings from the past.

author: Florian
comment: Es wird immer schlechter. Erst kamen keine Unwetterwarnungen mehr. Jetzt kommen nicht Mal mehr die Vorwarnungen an. Und dafür soll man Geld bezahlen?!

author: Michael Power
comment: This is a good app however during hurricane season it should cover carribean area...
Keeps asking for premium

author: Ray Toms
comment: One of the best weather apps very accurate

author: Eddie Williams
comment: Awesome

author: Bob OHara
comment: A sever storm watch was just issued for my area. Alerts Pro correctly notified me. Yet when I first opened the alert only counties well north were highlighted, strangely enough even some in other states. I closed and opened again. Now on the map the correct ones are highlighted but in the list below which goes alphabetically it stops at the county that begins with the letter C. What good is that?
title: Not working properly

author: Mark Scott
comment: Decided to see what my £8.99 purchase could get me as Weather Pro justified there increased pricing partly due to access of a couple of extra apps.  Well I've had to ask for 3 locations to be updated. Just happened to be the three I use.  Disappointed that each of the locations I added were at least 2 miles wrong. From Nw to Ne UK.  Its thrown in to justify the price hike. I wouldn't pay for this app on its own. In my opinion its not a finished product. I would be asking for a refund. Disappointed.
title: Wrong locations

author: Richard Cassidy
comment: App suggests you save locations for alerts. But i keep being alerted to weather events that do not exist and are hundreds of miles away. Useless and unreliable app.
title: It does not work

author: Ricky-John Kirkman
comment: How much money? This service is rubbish you should be ashamed of yourself for asking so much, i'l give you 10 UK pence for it all not a shilling more! Get a life we in the UK don't need this.
title: Tight arse

author: Alexis Gutierrez
comment: It show what kind of weather and it makes a beep sound

author: Gail Link
comment: I like this app and find it very useful but is there a way to only have notifications between say 8am and 10pm?
title: Notification

author: O Maden
comment: If you are looking for a proper weather app, hence the price, this is for you
title: For weather pros

author: Tamica Wiley
comment: It's perfect for me I don't know about you guys but this is my opinion I like it

author: Ken Myers
comment: What good is it if it cannot find my location?  Uninstalling

author: Ani Barker
comment: Missed major frost

author: Michael Haas
comment: In Germany this app is spot on!
title: Very good

author: James Redwood
comment: Not bad
title: Alerts

author: Alan Winston
comment: Is this beta software? I can't find a way to remove a favorite or disable notifications for individual favorites. I certainly don't want to be getting alerts for everyplace I've ever contemplated going on a trip or outing. I'm uninstalling this app while I reconsider its possible usefulness.
title: beta?

author: Sean Burns
comment: This app is acully pretty good... But the 2 things are, first you shouln't make everything "premium", and the forecasts aren't that accurate. Other than that, this is an ok app.
title: This app is OK...

author: Bayushi Mamoru
comment: Warnings still don't trigger push notification, and there's no "About" in any menu. Neither in the Menu nor in Settings nor in Help.

reply.author: MeteoGroup
reply.content: Please contact our support team via menu / “About” / “Submit a request” and provide more detailed information about the occurring problem.

title: No more warnings?

author: Dave Contarino
comment: Seems like every button I press requires premium.

author: Max Higareda
comment: Description
title: Title

author: James Mullins
comment: Every good weather app will tell you if there's bad weather on the way,eg eweather,arcus,foreca etc
title: Useless a money racket

author: Alan G
comment: Can't see anyway to change from metric to imperial for wind speed?  Only displaying KPH and no MPH, MS, etc.
title: Nice, but.

author: Edward -Absolem-
comment: Work well. Does exactly what it's supposed to do. A reminder: The app is not faulty if the information provided to it is faulty.
title: Samsung Galaxy S5

author: john cliffe
comment: Do a trial use or something. The intrusive ads make it unusable and annoying to the point where you just uninstall. Really poor. Avoid.

reply.author: MeteoGroup
reply.content: This app offers reliable data and undergoes ongoing development/support, which generates costs (licenses, backend development etc.) These costs are met by ads shown in-app or by the optional premium service, without which, there would be no option to permanently offer this app as a free download.

title: Free version unusable

author: turbonetic777
comment: We have a tornado watch right now and it says that Fuquay varina is having a tornado watch. I can definitely trust this app. I'm going to give this app five stars. I love it😊😊😊😊😊😊😊
title: I love this app

comment: When it detects your location and accepts it, it always says "no data" for where you are located. What's the point?!  And if you want to look at the radar map to zoom in you have to pay $6? Ha  ha why? There are plenty of free radar apps.
title: Garbage

author: Bruce Bracken
comment: So here I am with a 2 day old alert. The app says there's no alert here but the widget carries on telling me that there was an alter that's expired. Other than that it seems to work.
title: Widget won't clear past alerts

author: Jennifer Winston
comment: You can't even zoom out.. You have to purchase in order to zoom out of the radar... You kidding me?..
title: Terrible

author: Darren Mullins
comment: Brilliant app, i have had it on my last two phones and been very happy with it, the only improvement i would like to see, is adding Tornado watches and warnings for the United Kingdom
title: Samsung Galaxy S5
